element.definition: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.
The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

binding.description: A human language.

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

If a grouping item then 'GROUP' otherwise it is a node therefore a code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.definition: The date when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.
The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.short: Fee, charge or cost per point
element.definition: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.requirements: If a fee is present the associated product/service code must be present.

element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the good or service delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for services and/or goods, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.
element.requirements: If a fee is present the associated product/service code must be present.

element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional  service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.requirements: If a fee is present the associated product/service code must be present.

element.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
element.requirements: The UDI code and issuer if applicable for the supplied product.

binding.description: The FDA, or other, UDI repository.

element.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).

binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

The relationship of the patient to the subscriber.
element.requirements: To determine the relationship between the patient and the subscriber.

binding.description: The code for the relationship of the patient to the subscriber.

element.definition: A list of references from the Insurer to which these services pertain.
element.requirements: To provide any pre=determination or prior authorization reference.

element.definition: The Coverages adjudication details.
element.requirements: Used by downstream payers to determine what balance remains and the net payable.

element.definition: The style (standard) and version of the original material which was converted into this resource.
element.requirements: Knowledge of the original version can inform the processing of this instance so that information which is processable by the originating system may be generated.

binding.description: The static and dynamic model to which contents conform, which may be business version or standard/version.

element.definition: Factors which may influence the applicability of coverage.
element.requirements: To determine extenuating circumstances for coverage.

binding.description: The eligibility exception codes.

element.definition: Name of school for over-aged dependents.
element.requirements: Often required for over-age dependents.

element.definition: Date of an accident which these services are addressing.
element.requirements: Coverage may be dependent on accidents.

element.definition: Type of accident: work, auto, etc.
element.requirements: Coverage may be dependent on the type of accident.

binding.description: Type of accident: work place, auto, etc.

element.definition: A list of intervention and exception codes which may influence the adjudication of the claim.
element.requirements: Coverage may be modified based on exception information provided.

binding.description: Intervention and exception codes (Pharm).

element.definition: First tier of goods and services.
A service line number.

element.short: Group or type of product or service
element.definition: The type of product or service.

binding.description: Service, Product, Rx Dispense, Rx Compound etc.

element.definition: The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.
Diagnosis applicable for this service or product line.
If a grouping item then 'GROUP' otherwise it is a node therefore a code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.definition: The date when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.
The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.short: Fee, charge or cost per point
element.definition: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.requirements: If a fee is present the associated product/service code must be present.

element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the good or service delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for services and/or goods, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.
element.requirements: If a fee is present the associated product/service code must be present.

element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional  service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.requirements: If a fee is present the associated product/service code must be present.

element.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
element.requirements: The UDI code and issuer if applicable for the supplied product.

binding.description: The FDA, or other, UDI repository.

element.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).

binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

element.definition: A region or surface of the site, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes, e.g. for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.
element.requirements: May impact on adjudication.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, e.g. for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.definition: Code to indicate that Xrays, images, emails, documents, models or attachments are being sent in support of this submission.

element.definition: A list of teeth which would be expected but are not found due to having been previously  extracted or for other reasons.
element.requirements: The list of missing teeth may influence the adjudication of services for example with Bridges.

element.definition: The code identifying which tooth is missing.
element.requirements: Provides the tooth number of the missing tooth.

binding.description: The codes for the teeth, subset of OralSites.

element.definition: Missing reason may be: E-extraction, O-other.
element.requirements: Provides the reason for the missing tooth.

binding.description: Reason codes for the missing teeth.

element.definition: The date of the extraction either known from records or patient reported estimate.
element.requirements: Some services and adjudications require this information.
